main.name: Geoffrey G. Gaswint
main.occupation: Ph. D. Candidate in Particle Physics
main.description: During my graduate career, I have done research in neutrino based astronomy remotely at UCI and locally at our detector in Antarctica. My research mainly involves simulations and analysis of neutrino physics. I have many years experience in software engineering, either indirectly through my academic career and for fun on my own, or directly as a systems enginner at Raytheon.
main.bio: Doctorate in Physics - December 2020. I have done research in neutrino based astronomy remotely at UCI and locally at our detectors in Antarctica. My research mainly involves simulations and analysis of neutrino physics. I have many years experience in software engineering, either indirectly through my academic career and for fun on my own, or directly as a systems engineer at Raytheon.
main.contactmessage: Please contact me by email or phone.

resume.skillmessage: I have been coding for +8 years and recenetly found a new passion in app development using react native. All of my apps are submitted to gitHub and are published on the apple and google play store. I am also fluent in Math and Physics with +5 years of teaching experience.

education.description: Led science expeditions in Antarctica, simulated neutrino detector physics, analyzed large sets of data, further progressed theories on the origins of mass and the source of matter-antimatter asymmetry.

education.degree: B.A. in Physics, B.A. in Pure Mathematics
education.description: Studied dark matter detectors, and helped develop dark matter simulations.

work.title: Systems Engineer
work.description: Worked on simulations (classified). Known for fixing complex bugs. Left job to pursue dream of higher education.

work.title: Researcher: Author or Co-Author
work.description: Published papers under experimental and thoeretical physics (links under publications section).

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
